xxl.core.functions
Class FastMapProjection<T>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<T,double[]>
      xxl.core.functions.FastMapProjection<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the objects to be projected, i.e., the object-space.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<T,double[]>
public class FastMapProjection<T>
extends AbstractFunction<T,double[]>

This class provides a projection from any object-space with a given distance function to a k-dimensional real valued metric space (using the euklidean distance function, also known as L2-Metric) using the FastMap algorithm. The implementation is based upon [FL95 ]: Christos Faloutsos, King-Ip Lin. FastMap: A Fast Algorithm for Indexing, Data-Mining and Visualization of Traditional and Multimedia Datasets. SIGMOD Conference 1995. 163-174.

Due to the lack of an efficient memory management in java the original algorithm is modified. Instead of computing and storing a distance matrix in advance only the pivot objects of each dimension are computed in advance and the modified distance function for each dimension will be recursivly evaluated.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
protected  java.util.List<T> a
          Stores the computed pivot elements (left) for the dimension denoted by the index.
protected  java.util.List<T> b

Field Detail

dim

protected int dim
The chosen dimension.

a

protected java.util.List<T> a
Stores the computed pivot elements (left) for the dimension denoted by the index.

b

protected java.util.List<T> b
Stores the computed pivot elements (right) for the dimension denoted by the index.

dist

protected Distance<? super T> dist
The distance function used for the object space.

d

protected double[] d
Stores the distances between the pivot-objects. d[k] is the distance between a[k] and b[k]. Used for effectiveness.

data

protected TeeCursor<? extends T> data
Given objects of the object space. A tee cursor* is used because in order to compute the pivot elements in advance one must scan the data 2*k times, i.e. the complexity of locating the pivot elements is O(2kn) whereas n denotes the number of objects in the cursor.

See Also:
Cursor, TeeCursor

teecursorInit

protected boolean teecursorInit
Indicates whether the tee cursor has been used at least one time.

Constructor Detail

FastMapProjection

public FastMapProjection(TeeCursor<? extends T> data,
                         int dimension,
                         Distance<? super T> dist)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a new FastMap Projection based upon the data given.

Parameters:
data - init data.
dimension - dimension to project data to.
dist - distance function for the kind of data given in data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given dimension isn't at least 1 or the given tee cursor doesn't support multiple access.
See Also:
TeeCursor, Distance

FastMapProjection

public FastMapProjection(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> data,
                         int dimension,
                         Distance<? super T> dist)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a new FastMap Projection based upon the data given. The given data will be wrapped by a tee cursor in order to support multiple access to the data. For default a TeeCursor is used.

Parameters:
data - init data. Will be wrapped by a tee cursor to support multiple access.
dimension - dimension to project data to.
dist - distance function for the kind of data given.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given dimension isn't at least 1.
See Also:
TeeCursor, TeeCursor, Distance
Method Detail

invoke

public double[] invoke(T x)
Returns a projection to a k-dimensional real valued space of the given Object as an object of type double[k].

Specified by:
invoke in interface Function<T,double[]>
Overrides:
invoke in class AbstractFunction<T,double[]>
Parameters:
x - object to project to a subspace.
Returns:
projected object (represented by a double[] of dimension k.)

init

protected void init()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Determines the pivot objects for each dimension needed. The complexity of the initialization is O(2kn) where n denotes the number of objects in the given tee cursor and k the given dimensions.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the tee cursor doesn't support adequate multiple access.

getFurthermost

protected T getFurthermost(int k,
                           T p)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Returns the furthermost object wrt to p.

Parameters:
k - specifies the aggregation level of the distance function used to compute the furthermost object.
p - reference object.
Returns:
the furthermost object wrt to p.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the tee cursor doesn't support adequate multiple access.

d

protected double d(int k,
                   T l,
                   T r)
Returns the projected distance between the objects l and r.

Parameters:
k - Specifies the aggregation level of the distance function.
l - left object for distance computing.
r - right object for distance computing.
Returns:
the modified distance between two objects of given aggregation level.

p

protected double p(int k,
                   T o)
Returns the k-th component of the FastMap-Projection of o.

Parameters:
o - the object to project.
k - dimension of the subspace the object is projected to.
Returns:
the k-th component of the projection of object o.
